intro: Apargia hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Apargia hispanica is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
